title: LocaGroca (Food)
problem: Generic delivery apps can feel so cold and robotic, and honestly, the code behind them often gets just as messy. I wanted to build something that felt human and welcoming.
approach: I built this app with a focus on warmth and simplicity. Using SwiftUI, I created smooth, friendly animations that make the app feel alive. Under the hood, I kept things tidy with a clean structure (MVVM) so it's easy to update and keeps working smoothly.
outcome: A delightful, easy-to-use food app that connects people with local markets, built on code thats as fresh as the produce.

title: Grocery System
problem: It's super frustrating when you order something online only to find out later it's out of stock. That disconnect between the app and the warehouse is a real pain.
approach: I connected the mobile app directly to the backend systems so they talk to each other in real-time. By keeping the server environment consistent (using containerization concepts), I made sure that what you see on your phone is exactly what's on the shelf.
outcome: A reliable shopping experience where inventory is always in sync, so no more disappointing out-of-stock emails.

title: Home Services (MVC)
problem: Ever look at older websites and feel like the code is just a tangled mess of spaghetti? It makes adding new features scary because one small change breaks everything.
approach: I decided to build my own framework to keep things organized. I separated the data, the logic, and what the user sees into their own lanes. It's like having a tidy filing cabinet instead of a messy desk—everything has its place.
outcome: A clean, organized system that's easy to maintain and grow, proving that a little structure goes a long way.

title: LibraCore (Library)
problem: Library websites are notorious for being boring and clunky. I wanted to change that perception and make discovering knowledge feel exciting and modern.
approach: I treated each part of the interface like a building block (component) using React. This keeps the design consistent and the interactions snappy. It's built to be robust, so you don't run into weird glitches while browsing.
outcome: A 'World of Knowledge' that feels more like a modern app and less like a dusty archive, making learning fun again.

title: Futuristic Banking
problem: Banking apps are usually safe but boring, or pretty but glitched. I wanted to prove you can have both: a secure vault that looks like a high-end tech product.
approach: I used a strict 'one-way street' logic for data to make sure your balance is always accurate—no guessing games. key wrapped this rock-solid logic in a sleek, Apple-inspired 3D design to make finance feel premium.
outcome: A banking platform that you actually enjoy looking at, combining verified security with a top-tier visual experience.

title: Resume / Portfolio
problem: Updating a portfolio shouldn't be a chore. I didn't want to dive into code every time I just wanted to fix a typo or add a new project.
approach: I built this site to be smart. It reads all my data from a simple file, so I can update my content easily without breaking the site. It's like having a CMS (Content Management System) built right in.
outcome: A living, breathing website that grows with me, showing that even simple projects deserve smart engineering.

title: Hospital System
problem: Hospital administration is often bogged down by paper trails and disconnected systems, leading to slower patient care.
approach: I developed a centralized management system using C# and Blazor. I focused on a clean architecture to handle patient records securely and efficiently, ensuring sensitive data is isolated but accessible to authorized personnel.
outcome: A streamlined platform that reduces administrative overhead and lets healthcare providers focus more on patients.

title: Grocery Manager
problem: Managing stock across multiple grocery departments is chaotic without a unified view, leading to waste and lost sales.
approach: I built a robust inventory tracking application using C# and MVC. It features real-time stock level monitoring and automated alerts for low inventory, all powered by a highly optimized SQL backend.
outcome: Improved inventory accuracy and operational efficiency, significantly reducing food waste.

title: Booking System
problem: scheduling conflicts are a major headache for service-based businesses, often resulting in double bookings and frustrated clients.
approach: This ASP.NET Core solution implements a conflict-detection algorithm to ensure zero overlap. I used a code-first approach with Entity Framework to design a flexible database schema that adapts to different service types.
outcome: A reliable scheduling tool that eliminates booking errors and improves customer trust.

title: Library Catalog
problem: Traditional library searches can be slow and unforgiving if you don't know the exact book title.
approach: I created a smart cataloging system using C# that supports fuzzy search and advanced filtering. The system uses a clean N-Tier architecture to separate the user interface from the complex search logic.
outcome: Users can find resources instantly, even with partial information, making the library much more accessible.

title: Virtual Classroom
problem: Remote learning often feels disconnected, with tools that lack the interactivity of a real classroom.
approach: I architected a virtual learning environment using ASP.NET. It features real-time assignment tracking and a discussion board, leveraging SignalR for instant communication between students and teachers.
outcome: A cohesive digital learning space that fosters better engagement and streamlines course management.

title: Snake Game
problem: Understanding the core mechanics of game loops and object-oriented collision detection is fundamental for any developer, yet often overlooked.
approach: I built this classic game from the ground up using pure C#. It focuses on memory management and performant logic loops to ensure smooth gameplay without heavy engine overhead.
outcome: A flawlessly smooth retro gaming experience that demonstrates strong command of core programming algorithms.
